alert.note: Alert for Adjuntas; Ciales; Jayuya; Orocovis; Utuado (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 20 at 3:43PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Adjuntas, Ciales, Jayuya, Orocovis and Utuado. * WHEN...Until 545 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 243 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Excessive runoff from the heavy rains will affect rivers and streams across these areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jayuya, Adjuntas, Utuado, Ciales, Orocovis and Cayuco. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
